scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Elizabeth writes that she has been sick with influenza. She writes about a Mr. Harwood. She complains that Peggy's letters are not long enough. Wants to hear something of every person in Williamsburg. Wants to know how Mr. Greenhow's family is. Mentions Mr. R and family, who have a niece named Courtenay. Asks if Courtenay is to be married to Mr. L. Mentions C. T. Asks if P{eter} Carr or his brother have visited her this winter. Thinks Peggy's description of Mr. W-k-m is well drawn. Wants to be presented affectionately to Peggy's mama. Correspondents tentatively identified as Elizabeth Fairfax Griffith and Margaret Davenport Coalter, but lacking proof.
